verb.description: (with reference to a wheeled vehicle or its occupants) move or cause to move slowly and heavily, typically in a noisy or uneven way.
examples: we trundled a wheelbarrow down to the river and collected driftwood

noun.description: An act of moving slowly or heavily.

origin: Mid 16th century (denoting a small wheel or roller): a parallel formation to obsolete or dialect trendle, trindle revolve; related to trend.
